You may turn to the right if the way is clear
You may proceed straight through if the way is clear
You may do any of the above

question: To what penalties is a driver liable who is convicted of driving while disqualified?
1. A fine of $500 or imprisonment for six months or both.
2. Impoundment of the motor vehicle being operated for three months.
3. An additional 6 month period of suspension of driving privilege.
4. Any or all of the above.
When it is safe to do so, passing other vehicles on the right sides:
1. Is permitted on any street of highway.
2. Is permitted providing it is possible to do so by driving on the shoulder of the road.
3. Is not permitted under any circumstances.
4. Is not permitted when the street or highway has two or more lanes for traffic in the direction you are traveling.

1. Stop and wait for green light before making turn in the direction of the arrow.

3. Stop and then proceed.
4. The green arrow is a signal for pedestrians only.

1. When the way is clear.
2. On any red light.
3. From a one way street into a one-way street when the way is clear and the vehicle has been brought to a full stop.
4. From a two way street into a two way street when the way is clear, and the vehicle has been brought to a full stop.

Accelerate and steer to the left

3. When centre-line markings have just been painted.
4. When the highway is new and first used by the public.

3. Slow down when entering curve only when pavement is slippery.

1. Between dust and dawn and at any other time you cannot see clearly for a distance of 150 meters (500 ft).
2. Between ½ hour before sunset to ½ hour after sunrise and at any other time you cannot see clearly for a distance of 150 meters (500 ft).
3. Between sunset and sunrise.
4. No specified time.

questions.answer: The one approaching from the right

3. Yield right-of-way to all vehicles approaching on the highway.
4. Give hand signal then take right-of-way.

questions.question: It is more dangerous to drive at the maximum speed limit at night than during day time because:
options: The roadways are more apt to be slippery at night
You cannot see as far as ahead at night
Your reaction time is slower at night
Some drivers unlawfully drive with parking lights only
questions.answer: You cannot see as far as ahead at night
